page.title: 11TATTERSHALL CASTLE
page.content: The original Tattershall Castle was built in{1231}by Robert de Tateshale. That's how the castle and the village got its name. The castle was extended by{Ralph Lord Cromwell}in{1440.}In 1573_1693 the Earls of Lincoln lived in the castle. It was opened to the public in{1914 on{ 8th August}when owned by Lord Cromwell.He replaced the fireplaces for which it was famous. Lord Cromwell restored the castle and put in concrete floors and roof. In 1925 it was bequeathed to the National Trust. {In 1984 they had 27,779 visitors.}In 1984_1985 they took the concrete roof off because it was too heavy which made the beams sag so they put a timber roof on covered with asphalt.
